title: Island Geography Quiz
description: Set sail across the world's oceans and test your knowledge of famous islands and their geography.

questions.question: Greenland, the world's largest island, is an autonomous territory of which European country?
Madagascar, the world's fourth-largest island, is located off the southeastern coast of which continent?
The island of Borneo is shared by three countries: Malaysia, Indonesia, and which other?
The Galápagos Islands, famous for inspiring Darwin's theory of evolution, belong to which country?
Sicily, the largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, is part of which country?
The Maldives, a popular tropical destination, is an island nation located in which ocean?
Bali, known as the 'Island of the Gods,' is part of which Southeast Asian country?
Hawaii, the most isolated population center on Earth, is located in which ocean?
Crete, the largest of the Greek islands, was home to which ancient civilization?
Tasmania, an island state known for its wilderness, belongs to which country?
Sri Lanka, formerly known as Ceylon, is located off the southern tip of which country?
Zanzibar, known as the 'Spice Island,' is part of which East African country?
New Guinea, the world's second-largest island, is divided between Indonesia and which independent nation?
The Canary Islands, a popular holiday destination in the Atlantic Ocean, belong to which European country?
Svalbard, a Norwegian archipelago in the Arctic Ocean, is home to a famous global seed vault located in which town?
